definition: to reside/to live/to dwell/to be in/to be situated at/to stay/to get along with/to be in a position of/to deal with/to discipline/to punish
place/location/spot/point/office/department/bureau/respect/classifier for locations or items of damage: spot, point

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
handsome/refined/elegant/graceful/superior/show (loanword)/CL:場|场[chang2]/(literary) to grow/to bloom/(of crops) to produce ears

sentences.english: We faced Leyton Orient and it was actually my debut.
sentences.chinese: 我们的对手是莱顿东方，实际上那是我的处子秀。

sentences.english: Beckham came through the youth system at Old Trafford and made his debut in 1993.
sentences.chinese: 贝克汉姆出自曼联青训营，1993年完成处子秀。

sentences.english: A teaser will debut on Tuesday on MTV.
sentences.chinese: 一个玩笑话将在周二就MTV的处子秀。

sentences.english: Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain made his debut in that game and I'll be picking him up.
sentences.chinese: 张伯伦在那场比赛完成他的处子秀，我将会去鼓舞他。

sentences.english: Sotirios Kyrgiakos made his Liverpool debut at Bolton back in August.
sentences.chinese: 基里亚科斯八月面对博尔顿上演他的利物浦处子秀。

sentences.english: The debuts of the new players were positive, " he said."
sentences.chinese: 新球员的处子秀很积极。

sentences.english: He was very young and only 16 when he made his first team debut for Charlton.
sentences.chinese: 他灰常年轻，仅仅16岁就代表查尔顿上演处子秀。

sentences.english: Hugo Rodallega made his Wigan debut as a substitute in this fixture last season.
sentences.chinese: 上赛季两队交锋中罗达雷加作为替补上演他的处子秀。

definition: hat trick (when one player scores three goals)
(of a performer) to come onto the stage to perform/(of an athlete) to enter the arena to compete/(fig.) to enter the scene (e.g. a new product)/(of an examinee etc) to leave the venue
Super Cup (various sports)/Super Bowl (American football championship game)
Super Cup (various sports)/Super Bowl (American football championship game)
poised for battle/to square up for a fight
